task_summary: The robot arm opens the oven door in a toy kitchen environment.

task_long_description.overview: A stationary manipulator is tasked to open the oven door of a toy kitchen. The task involves localizing the oven door, approaching and aligning the arm to its handle, actuating the motion to open the hinged door, and verifying it is open. Environmental constraints include the limited reach of the manipulator, potential occlusions, and the fixed positions of other kitchen items.
preconditions: Manipulator arm is free and unoccupied
No obstacles block access to the oven door
stepwise_plan: Approach and align to the oven door handle
Perform actuation to open the door
failure_and_recovery: Failure to detect oven door leads to retry
Actuation failure prompts retry or abort
task_long_description.termination: Tree finishes when oven door is confirmed open or an unrecoverable error occurs.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the oven door is visible to the robot's sensors.
Attempts to detect the oven door using perception modules.
Moves the end effector to approach and align with the oven door for manipulation.
Executes the mechanical action to open the oven door.
Checks that the oven door is now open.

failure_modes: Alignment fails due to occlusion or bad pose
Door resists movement or is obstructed
recovery_strategy: Realign if not at correct approach pose before actuation
Abort after set retries if mechanical opening fails
assumptions: Instruction specifies 'open the oven door', which matches the target observed in all frames
No explicit 'grasp' needed since door likely lacks a small handle (visual evidence: flat handle bar)
Frames show only partial opening; completion is inferred at frame_6
No conflicting cues between instruction and images

expected_success_criteria: Oven door is physically open after sequence execution
